abstract: The company said acquiring Next New Networks would move it toward more professionally produced content and help it compete with Hulu.com, iTunes and Netflix.
snippet: The company said acquiring Next New Networks would move it toward more professionally produced content and help it compete with Hulu.com, iTunes and Netflix.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  YouTube, the video site owned by Google, formally announced on Monday that it had acquired Next New Networks, a Web video production company, in its biggest effort yet to move beyond short, quirky home videos to professionally produced content.

headline.main: YouTube Acquires a Producer of Videos
headline.print_headline: YouTube Acquires A Producer Of Videos
